Package com.example.braiveassignment.controllers

Class FlightAPIController

java.lang.Object
com.example.braiveassignment.controllers.FlightAPIController
@RestController
public class FlightAPIController
extends java.lang.Object
The main API controller of the application It contains all the url mappings and methods for the actions a user can take

    • createFlight

      @PostMapping(path="/api/add") public void createFlight​(@RequestParam java.lang.String name, @RequestParam java.lang.String number, @RequestParam @DateTimeFormat(pattern="yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm") java.time.LocalDateTime scheduledTime, @RequestParam @DateTimeFormat(pattern="yyyy-MM-dd\'T\'HH:mm") java.time.LocalDateTime arrivalTime, @RequestParam java.lang.String departure, @RequestParam java.lang.String destination, @RequestParam java.lang.Double fare)
      The user can add a flight only when all field values have been given. The id filed is not included since it is geneated by database
      Parameters:

      number -
      scheduledTime -
      arrivalTime -

      destination -

    • findPaginated

      @GetMapping(path="/api/search") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object>> findPaginated​(@RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String name, @RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String departure, @RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String destination, @RequestParam(required=false) java.time.LocalDateTime scheduled, @RequestParam(defaultValue="1") int pageNumber, @RequestParam(defaultValue="2") int pageSize)
      The user can search for all flights that satisfy a combination of fields. The result is a union of the different searches. All parameters are optional
      Parameters:
      name -
      departure -
      destination -
      scheduled -
      pageNumber -
      pageSize -

      The user can see all the flights displayed in pages. If the user does not give page number and size, default values are applied
